intro: Eurycaulis endertii, commonly known as the Endert's eurycaulis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth surface and a slight pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
